alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 5:33PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pinal County through 615 PM MST... At 533 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kings Ranch, or near Gold Canyon, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Queen Valley, Boyce Thompson Arboretum and Gold Camp. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 205 and 210, and between mile markers 215 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Superior
